question.body: Which of the following portions of the trachea is properly matched with its structure?

multiple_choice.choice: Trachealis smooth muscle- constricts when someone coughs
The mucosa- contains blood vessels,nerves, assorted connective tissues, and mucus glands
The submucosa - connects the trachea to the surrounding structures and tissues
The outer adventitia- the layer facing the lumen

response.feedback: Correct. The trachealis smooth muscle located in the opening of the C-shaped cartilages will constrict when someone coughs to increase the force of the cough.
Incorrect. The mucosa is the innermost layer that faces the lumen of the trachea. It does not contain the blood vessels and nerves.

Incorrect. The submucosa is the middle of the three layers of the tracheal wall and contains the nerves and blood vessels. It cannot connect with the surrounding tissues because it is the middle layer.
Incorrect. The outer adventitia is the outermost layer of the tracheal wall, not the inner layer that faces the lumen.
